texts.textentryhtml: Possibly Alfred Stendahl, 1950-1952; possibly Jacques Sarlie Collection; [Stendahl Gallery, Los Angeles, CA, until 1968]; private collection, 1968-2013; [Bonham's New York Sale in January 11, 2013, lot 15]; purchased by the Princeton University Art Museum, 2013.

caption: Late Formative Period (San Sebastián Red style), 200 BCE–250 CE, Jalisco/Nayarit border, Magdalenas basin, Mexico, Mesoamerica, Male-figure with cup and club. Red-slipped ceramic with resist-slipped black designs; 52.1 × 25.1 × 27.1 cm. Museum purchase, David L. Meginnity, Class of 1958, Fund (2013-118)
